content:
Route Apple Messages Inquiries by Intent and Group

Provide more efficient, personalized service by routing inquiries sent in Apple Messages based on their origin.

Available in: Lightning Experience.
This article applies to: Enhanced Apple Messages for Business channels.
This article doesn’t apply to: Messaging for In-App, Messaging for Web, Bring Your Own Channel, standard and enhanced WhatsApp, standard and enhanced Facebook Messenger, and standard and enhanced SMS channels.

When you add a custom button to a mobile app or website that lets customers contact you in Apple Messages, you can add variables to the button link that give Salesforce clue’s about the conversation’s origin. The intent variable represents the customer’s intent (such as getting tech support), while the group variable represents the department that’s best qualified to handle the inquiry.

Step 1: Set Up Your Links

Configure a link that leads to your Apple Messages for Business channel, and add the link to a website or mobile app.

Example link: https://bcrw.apple.com/urn:biz:9c231233-d943-482a-b913-7c625ba19988?biz-intent-id=tech_question&biz-group-id=general_support&body=Get%20Tech%20Support

Step 2: Configure Your Omni-Channel Flow

Design an Omni-Channel flow that routes messages based on intent ID, group ID, or both.

When creating your Apple Messages for Business channel, select a routing type of Omni-Flow and select the flow that will control routing for your channel.
Update the Omni-Channel flow to include intent- or group-based routing.
Add two flow input variables named intentId and groupId.
Add flow decisions that reference these variables.

Step 3: Map the Variables to Your Channel

Map the Intent and Group parameters to your flow variables.

On the Messaging Settings page, click the name of your Apple Messages for Business channel.
In the Parameter Mappings section, click New.
For Parameter, select Intent or Group, which are automatically available as standard parameters.
For Flow Variable Name, enter the name of the flow variable you created: intentId or groupId.
title: Routing Apple Messages by Intent and Group
